intro: Tounatea leiocalycina, commonly known as the white-veined tounatea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, white flowers with prominent yellow veins, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and often have a velvety texture. Tounatea leiocalycina is typically found in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
